intro: Cardamine nuttallii var. pulcherrima, commonly known as the showy watercress, is a flowering plant in the family Brassicaceae. It is native to the moist, shaded areas of North America, particularly in the western United States. The plant features delicate, fern-like leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. It thrives in cool, damp environments and is often found near streams and in woodland habitats. Its botanical characteristics make it an interesting subject for both ecological studies and horticultural cultivation.
